posts.title: Building a Bootloader
posts.description: I'll build a bootloader from scratch for an Intel x86 32-bit processor in this post. You should have some assembly experience before embarking on your bootloader journey.
posts.name: building-a-bootloader

posts.title: Kotlin and Error Handling
posts.description: Handling errors cleanly in Kotlin. Which layer do I handle my exceptions and how do I prevent try catch hell?
posts.name: kotlin-error-handling

posts.title: On Pattern Recognition and Closed Systems
posts.description: Owl: Whoo, well who-ello my friends, I'm delighted to have you stop by just in time for my extra delicious Banana flavored tea with spam, eggs and fried marmot!
posts.name: pattern-recognition

posts.title: Predicting Solar Flares Using Machine Learning
posts.description: Predicting solar flares using machine learning. In this post, I'll build a math library to calculate various constants from a solar magnetogram then predict if it's going to flare in the near future.
posts.name: solar-flare-forecasting

posts.title: Measure Theory
posts.description: In this post, I will first lay the basic analysis groundwork needed to understand Borel Sigma Algebras (and of course, I will also explain sigma algebras). Then I will explain the basics of Measure Theory necessary for defining Lp and weak-Lp spaces in subsequent blog posts.
posts.name: measure-theory

posts.title: Cantor, Natural Numbers and Formal Systems
posts.description: In this post, I will explore some properties of natural numbers and abstract systems in mathematics.
posts.name: nn-systems-cantor

posts.title: Some Silly Paradoxes
posts.description: In this post, I will explore some interesting paradoxes. I'll probably add to this post in the future, but for now, I just want this post to be about some silly little paradoxes that have shown up in math in the past.
posts.name: silly-paradoxes
